text: thumb|right|Santa Maria alla Scala, Milan. Engraving by Marc'Antonio Dal Re in Vedute di Milano, no. 71, c. 1745 Santa Maria alla Scala was a church built in the gothic style in Milan in 1381 and named in honour of Beatrice Regina della Scala, the wife of Bernabò Visconti who commissioned the building. The church was demolished in 1776 to make way for a new theatre which became known as Teatro alla Scala. ==Notes== Category:Buildings and structures completed in 1381 Category:Former churches in Italy Maria Category:1776 disestablishments Category:Gothic architecture in Milan
